body.p: Have you ever dropped a pebble in a pond and watched the ripples flow out from where the pebble landed?
And then tossed out several pebbles to see multiple ripples flow into and overlap one another over time?
There is a Native American concept of time as a pond and the ripples as events in our life.
Each of us is affected by the ripples flowing through us every day.
At the same time, the ripples we set in motion through our words and actions affect the people around us.
And every individual touched by our ripples creates new ripples that touch others.
Thus giving us each the great capacity to change the world.
Who have your ripples touched today?

bio.p: Teresa Pearson, MS, RN, CDE, FAADE, is owner of Innovative Health Care Designs and consultant with Halleland Habicht in Minneapolis, MN.
